front.title: A Framework for the Control Scheduling of Network Resources

abstract.t: This document presents a framework that elucidates various scheduling scenarios and identifies the entities involved in requesting scheduled changes of network resources or policy/action execution. It also addresses additional challenges such as conflict resolution, priority handling, and synchronization of scheduled tasks, ultimately enhancing the reliability and performance of network services. This document also describes the applicability of various network management tools and data models may be used, to meet the requirements of a set of representative use cases.
